email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out with a freight offer for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a vessel available, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. The starting freight rate is $52.50 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the offer. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit high compared to the current market. Would you consider $50.75 per metric ton? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s specifications and any demurrage terms? Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your response. I can bring the rate down to $51.25 per metric ton, which is competitive given the current market. The MV Ocean Star is in excellent condition, and the demurrage rate is $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $51.25 sounds reasonable. Can we lock in the laycan for 15-20 October? Also, please confirm the cargo size is 140,000 metric tons and that the incoterms are CFR Rotterdam. Looking forward to your confirmation. Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, confirmed. The laycan is 15-20 October, cargo size is 140,000 metric tons, and incoterms are CFR Rotterdam. I’ll send over the charter party agreement shortly. Thanks for your cooperation. Best, Sarah.
